DIPwZSbNbiHyj6buwKWotg.text: Fresh, Fresh, Fresh. Some of the best tasting Sushi I've ever had. I've been going there for years.   Johnny, the owner, is an excellent host. Share some Sake with the chef, they love to have fun too ! I can't complain about the 2-4-1 house Sake they are offering now.  Friday nights are packed. The Tuna Karai is excellent.

9OWj7Eiprm8UZL9N25YkxQ.text: This place is awesome! The sushi is great the staff is really fun. One of the cooks even made me a special sushi roll because I wasn't sure what to get. I highly recommend to come here.

e1oyPxhRnhxWwtwpUsoApg.text: There was a restaurant.com deal I picked up a few months back for $100 off $200 tab. I got some friends together (6 of us total) and went down to Henderson to give this place a shot. First off, the menu has photos, that's awesome! Makes me picking my sushi so much easier. We all started off with some warm saki and a few appetizers. When it came to the dinner, we all each, ordered 2 different rolls and just shared. My favorite was the Cherry Blossom, it was AMAZING! After we stuffed our faces with over 12 different rolls, we found out we were still $6 short of our $200 tab. I couldn't believe all of that was still under $200. So at the end, our bill was $144 with the gratuity that is added b/c of the gift certificate. So with that, we got 4 apps, 6 sake's, 6 sappora's, and 12 rolls. Great deal!

Rk0cv8ohsVFi-SGSIxSz9A.text: I've been here a number of times, but one day I decided I had a long day at work doing morning shift and wanted to wind down here for lunch.  I sat at the sushi bar and I was familiar with the staff, my old sushi chef from Yama Sushi was now here (surprise surprise) making my rolls.  I adore the Family Roll and the Leo Ball. The Mochi here is also excellent.  My previous experiences were all good. I had gone with a friend once and they had a super spicy roll. The waitress noticed they were having a hard time with how spicy it was, so she brought us FREE mochi ice cream.  I was expecting good service and good sushi. Few people were in there as it was lunchtime and a weekday.  Regardless of there being multiple sushi chefs and very few customers (4 at most), my rolls weren't made very well and they took a while to arrive, even with help. My drink was constantly empty. And the worst part (and this is why I haven't returned since and didn't give 4-5 stars...), I WAITED OVER AN HOUR AND 20 MINUTES FOR MY CHECK. I must have asked for it in 10 different ways 20 different times to 5 different people...  I was at a loss. I wanted to dine and dash so badly, but I'm not like that. And hell, I haven't even gone back - so maybe I should have.  That was the most ridiculous experience ever and I turn the other way now and go to Sapporo down the street.  BUT...I was told that the head sushi chef here is willing to teach women how to make sushi. I don't know of anywhere else that is, and the sushi chefs here always tell me women weren't taught how to make sushi for the longest time. Interesting.

1kSYE0zYstABzmcY2YeJMw.text: We've been to Momoyama's multiple times, but really only because it's close to home. We're all sushi/Japanese food fanatics, and to us they are pretty mediocre. The nigiri style sushi is just ok...not amazingly fresh by any means. They do have a few cool rolls to try, and that really is their only strength. The miso soup is always weak, as is the service. I can't really recommend this place, as Vegas is chalk full of better places to get your raw fish on. However, if you find yourself in the area and hungry for sushi, go ahead and stop here. It'll be "ok".

QyT90ObPjqZFjg-sX-aRlA.text: Our favorite sushi place in Henderson. We love the sushi chefs & will only eat here when on this side of town.

pQU561GTYSL5ND0A9c1_Mg.text: Very good food I eat here often, hot & cold dishes. A friendly staff always gives a rousing "konnichiwa"" or "konbonwa" (good afternoon or evening) as you enter.  The atmosphere is great - once inside it's easy to forget about the outside world as the windows are tinted dark and Japanese screens hide the parking lot.  The decor is warm and traditional.  There is a nice flat screen behind the sushi bar that doesn't interfere and usually plays sports.

u-_QCS5WyC-r459r38tW2Q.text: By far my favorite sushi place in town!!  I have brought visitors off the strip who have claimed their favorite places cant be matched and they've admittedly stood corrected.This place doesn't overdo the fancy trendy dish presentation or ruin a perfectly good dish by trying to add their own signature flair. But they are by no means plain. All their chefs and waitresses are approachable and friendly when you want to try something new. If the ingredients on the market don't meet their standards they take the item off the menu, so when sea urchin is available you know its the best and freshest.. We all know urchin can not enjoyably be consumed any other way. Join their mailing list for coupons.  This is where you want to bring your friend who's never had sushi before... start them with baby steps. I usually introduce people by having them try "tara's fatti" before the more fishier dishes. For those who don't really like fishy flavors stick to all the baked and fried rolls with the variety of sauces. Ive been a loyal customer for 6 or 8 years.  All you can eat is not a deal breaker for me, but I think that might be for some unfortunately. Not that I want to deal with them being slammed with customers all the time, but I wish them all the success they deserve!

kMush5bR9i52nqzdQR1Ggw.text: I love this place!!! Delicious food and great service!!! Yay momo!!!

n2E5t3toecjGvWxvVLKzng.text: Ahhh Momo...how I love thee.  This place has sentimental value to me (my boyfriend took me here on our first date, which happened to be Valentine's Day as well).  The sushi is really good, it's not a showy place like Kabuki, Sushi Roku, etc., and if you're an Uni person (like my bf), they don't always have Uni, but supposedly Uni is not always in season.  With that being said, I really do like Momo, you can't go wrong with any of their rolls and it is not expensive at all.  The sushi chefs are very funny and friendly too (if you sit at the bar, they will take a shot of sake with you). The Screaming Orgasm has got to be my favorite.  Oh and the sushi one isn't bad neither.

F-auPLyoUVVovZOpk6v48Q.text: Meh, totally forgettable. I've had much worse and much better. If your in a pinch come here, but was hesitant to consume raw fish.

oRhaF4RpkEvNuSe9Nxca-g.text: I have gone a couple times with my wife. Great sushi and friendly staff

DAzFa6ImSzl2HdjCt-FTDA.text: A whole menu of creative and interesting sushi rolls. And alot of them have pictures, and pictures are always good. I had the Judy roll and the Irish roll for lunch yesterday. I cant remember what was in them, but they were both good. I just randomly picked them because I liked the names. Although, I cant figure out how they came up with the names...especially the Irish roll? It wasnt even green?  I'd go back...in fact I'm going to have to so I can ask more questions about the names...I need to get to the bottom of this.

nEM9uKBKkcrMUzj_Zcwl5g.text: I really enjoyed this restaurant.  There are some unique menu items that I have not seen at other establishments.  In fact, when I was there we ordered a roll that used noodles instead of rice, and it was yummy.  There are whiteboards behind the bar with tons of daily specials.  It is conveniently located near many stores, so you can work up an appetite shopping, then stop in for a bite to eat.

p4dvROqcW03_xAHZTv1dnA.text: Went to this place trusting Yelp to guide me right.  Overall feeling was "meh".  It just seemed there was no love in the food.  Tempura was just sufficient.  Nothing really stuck out as amazing.  I have absolutely no idea why it gets so many good reviews on the site.

isx8WwDG2iEJdDt42YyZXg.text: My favorite sushi joint ever since they opened almost 3 years ago I think!  When I lived over there, I ate at Momo's at least once a week!  And for the regulars, we get VIP cards that take a percentage of each bill and give cash back off a future bill of your choice.  Johnny always gets the freshest fish in and the sushi chefs are always talking and joking with the customers.  Highly recommend it to all of my friends!

XZSxWTbx6xITHBQI1KrjTg.text: We tried Momo Sushi for the first time tonight. The food was very good but the service was completely awful! We waited for ever for the food even though no one was there. Neither of the two waitresses had a clue as to what the are doing. We waited forever to get a check When we finally asked for a check (although it was clear we had been done fore some time), they still took another 10 minutes. We probably waited 20-25 minutes for a check so we could get out of there. We will not be back.

AvYmA-Bjq-vqszVkYYPdTQ.text: went in and sat at the bar the sushi chef let me know as soon i sat down it would be a couple of minutes before he could start my order. . . . .. i had about 3 generous servings of handrolls. . . . great service, my water was always filled, the staff was extremely nice.  would recommend if your by sunset station

S-P7j_65tWnBJHhsm-bhPg.text: I enjoy Momo Sushi for the great tast of their box meals... the Kalbi is delicious and I love their salad dressing.

MFcSMHJ6yDpeXFbWVMiA5g.text: I have never been to Momo Sushi before but decided to give it a try since I had bought a $25 gift certificate through restaurants.com. I went to the restaurant the same day I got my gift certificate and they said they no longer accepted the gift certificates even tho the certificate said it never expired. They where very rude about the whole thing and I will never go back to a restaurant that won't honor their own gift certificate. Funny thing is we went to one of our favorite sushi spots Island Sushi and spent $75 between 2 people. They missed out on some good paying customers that will never return ever again!

OqasBvJacTQISrEk7MTVfg.text: I called to see if this place is "Japanese" owned and asked TWICE. The girl responded YES TWICE. Well, she LIED! I was pretty pissed and after we left, I gave a $3 tip (dollar per person). I don't appreciate when people lie as it was Korean owned and they don't have the knowledge to cook Japanese food. Of course, most people don't know the difference between Japanese and Korean (except for Asians). And on top of that you can tell by the atmosphere that it's not Japanese....Never again.......

JDaCUYkxbTW6gF6Oe-8Nww.text: Went here because it was one of the few stores still open at 10 p.m. I got the Ninja box for about $15-16 which was not TOO pricy for a bento box dinner set. The set came with 3 pieces of shumai, a california roll (4 pieces?), salmon, vegetable and shrimp tempura, rice, and miso soup. The quality of everything was good, but nothing really stood out to me. I probably wouldn't go back since I have discovered some other pretty good sushi places which are either slightly comparable in price or even a little cheaper. If you are craving for sushi and are around the area, I'd say give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Ninja box

ON7ocxfUo3erb10o83dMOw.text: I am not hard to please and try to give benefit of the doubt more than I should but I have been disappointed on the service here on more than one occasion recently. I've been coming here for many years and the food has always been great but service is hit & miss.  Today I called in a order for 2 simple items, a Screaming O with extra sauce and a Jackpot Roll.  When I arrive, there were only 2 people dining so it wasn't busy, I pay for food and check my bag for the extra sauce I asked for.  My ticket had it on there but there was just the standard cup that always comes with the Screaming O.  I tell the waitress that I am missing it and she proceeds to tell me that the cup in there is extra.  Mind you I have been ordering this from there to go for over 10 years. Then the other waitress ask is everything ok and I show and tell her that it wasn't extra sauce and she says "sorry", I just stand there in shock that she is not getting my extra sauce but just looking at me. I then tell her that the service is not good and it clearly says extra sauce.  She them says you will have to pay extra for it.  I am baffled!!!! The ticket says extra sauce, you should have already charged me if there was a charge, how does it say it and you don't give it and yet have the nerve to tell me to pay more.  I just grabbed by bag and walked out.  I am sure the management will not respond or attempt to satisfy my lack of decent service. They will be loosing a longtime customer that spends and tips generously there.  Mind you I tipped the waitresses despite my frustration with them.  Step up your game Momo Sushi. There are many other choices around!!!

nDn5CMswgy1Jyvs7jtsv-Q.text: Went there as a farewell to Las Vegas,and had a few rolls as well as a cucumber salad. It was all very good. The place is a bit small so it can get loud and not much atmosphere although like I said the food was very good.  If I weren't moving out of state I would certainly go back and try some more.

Y0MkkFPTr5zWlXTcok1o5Q.text: The sushi was good, but the waitress never came back to check if we needed anything else. We placed our empty glasses to get a refill but they we not paying attention. I don't recommend this place because the service was awful.

bUFtfArCmPApZL9rS0me8g.text: Went on Sunday late afternoon. I would give it 4 stars if they would have turned the music off. I have no idea why any restaurant even bothers with music. It's simply irritating and detracts from an atmosphere of relaxation. I do not go to restaurants to be irritated by someone else's crappy taste in music coming out of tinny speakers.  The place was crowded. The tables are small and cramped. Very little space between tables too. Cramped enough that it was hard to find a place for our table of four to put stuff. The customers were well behaved at least.   The service was only adequate. There were too many customers for the waitresses to have to juggle, but they were pleasant and did a decent job. The menu is very extensive so at least everyone (including those that don't care for sushi) can find something they may like. The green salad with ginger dressing was the best thing I had. Generally there was nothing wrong with the food, but my impression is that the needle was pointing a little to the bland side. I think the prices are about where they normally would be for a Japanese restaurant, but I've had better values at other sushi restaurants. Generally speaking I was happy to have experienced dinner there with my spouse and friends. I recommend you give it a try at least. I think you will find it .... OK.

YW_RXJBgVRgDlynU6NBTWw.text: Finally found an authentic sushi place in Henderson area. Must try the Salmon Skin Hand Roll. Very crispy and generous serving of vegetables! Also if you like squid sushi, Creative Chef designed it an actual squid AND it has mint leaf the way it should! Everything was delicious - for Sushi lovers! Thank you Momo Sushi !!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. If you like squid sushi, then this is by far the most authentic as it has mint leaf. Creative Chef designed actual squid too!
Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Best Salmon Skin Roll ever! Very crispy with vegetables.

fiZPfMZWbI1ceOhT965EPg.text: Hands-down the best tasting best quality sushi in this area. Environment is clean. Staff is efficient service is good. Prices are a little high but you get what you pay for and it's worth it. Lunch specials are really worth coming in for.

dwRXB7eZAWJxFjhs6AVbUg.text: I will give 5 STARS next time, when the orange slice is not two days old. But thanks for the Gree Tea Ice cream YELP FREE DESSERT. Thank you to Andrew and the staff. They seemed tired and over work for a full house on Friday. But still gave a big smile.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

NMJNjPhJ-uio2wcjaO3u4g.text: Walked in here on my lunch because I've seen some of co-workers go here. This place is not an AYCE restaurant just FYI. Food was great I order there salmon and tuna bento. Service was nice and welcoming. Definitely will be going here again.

i5qt37aSZPKLAqpmqfJc_Q.text: The staff was talking to each other rather than serving the tables. Our order came wrong and one of the dishes came undercooked - cold in the middle

HYROUy21QVAB5mic1yYxWg.text: Likely our new go-to place. We were regulars at another place and often were treated like royalty so we kept going. On a whim we tried Momo takeout before a drive-in movie. Our first comment was, "if takeout is this good... we need to dine-in."  So, we did. And it was excellent. Fun, cheesy, welcoming and the fish was fresh while the rolls actually took us by surprise along with the check which was half of what we were used to. We're quickly going to be regulars here.

CC6s3v2ppqnOkeyCKlu_eQ.text: Just tried this place today, and it's my first time trying the sushi in Las Vegas. Thus far it is the worst sushi I ate in the U.S. And considering the reviews on this place, I'm hesitant to try sushi anywhere else in Vegas if this place is considered good. The fish is not cut right or to the correct size, it's definitely not fresh, and all together it tastes poor.  Today's was my first and last time at this place.

lc4_zlK1rrX3vj4f-eggqw.text: This is the best sushi place in Las Vegas. We always sit at the bar and Eric, James and ken take great care of us. If you are nice enough James might even give you some of his fresh wasabi.  We always get a sashimi plate, a fish or two on special and a roll. The fish is very fresh and is always cut great. The jonny roll, designed by the owner, is really good.  The atmosphere is great at the sushi bar. We always end up talking to the people siting by us and have a great time. If you like sushi, you need to come to momos!

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Eric&#39;s overtime special

5JVot8KdDqjbdADaQuD-Ng.text: This place was pretty good. I have had better sushi at other places though, but this location is very close to my house so I come here once in awhile to take care of any sushi cravings. The terrikai chicken bowl was pretty good too!

zjmZStxWNYr6gNj5_xJX_Q.text: I love MoMo's and would give it 5 stars.  The only thing that really bothers me is  the music is on w=a=y too loud!! I'm not one to sit at a restaurant and have to scream to my friends for conversation.  It's not very enjoyable. I mean who wants to have a meal and try to relax and enjoy with loud blaring music going on. It would be nice if the music was at a nice quaint level and not blaring like your at a Nite club!!

LaZxP77cLmN-NqX8APwNww.text: Very good place.  Not an AYCE but the nigiri and roll sizes are very large and filling.   I have had the uni twice here and it was also fresh and delicious.    I would have posted pictures but was too hungry to bother with the camera.  :)  Add AYCE to menu!

j2jpwdq2a3umKo_rZFzu2A.text: This was our first time coming here & we will definitely be back! Everything we tried was amazing, especially the screaming orgasm!

kd3-x3iDSJo_-UMfgC1eaA.text: The Irish roll is one of the best rolls I've had. The orgasm roll has such an amazing surprising flavor to it. Delicious!!

UcWv80aDnwNz0EYdtmdYhQ.text: My friend told me how great this place was the other day so I decided to give it a try. It was pretty late when I got there and the service was pretty good. Their food tasted great and their raw fish was really fresh. It's more expensive than most places but the quality of it was pretty worth. The oysters were 2 for $6.50 which is a lot more expensive than most places I've been to but their presentation was really nice.

srxencvpsSjKuHC360rz2A.text: Perfect place for a lunch with the family. The boxes were delicious-- I ordered it with chicken teriyaki and beef teriyaki. The beef was ok but I enjoyed the salad and rice and soup. The California roll is pretty good too :) I would recommend this for any who enjoy Japanese food!

L7HV3SzUlfGHd_qqJJLDfw.text: Momo sushi provided me with the best sushi i've ever tasted..The rolls were delicious, fresh,bright,flavorful and imaginative...OMG..The sashimi were so tender it melted in my mouth..It was excellent!!!I've never been disappointed by a visit here..I was also pleased with the service...We highly recommended this place!!!!

AE5YgLti_UinMyTgQ94GbA.text: Went there for a Friday night dinner. Great service and amazing food. They don't have AYCE but the prices were not bad at all. Probably the same price we pay for AYCE at other places. Will be going back for sure!

Ii7JmNjKtFnFNnaSjO2mpA.text: Dark atmosphere perfect for an intimate occasion and the food is amazing. Friendly sushi chefs and fast serving staff.

QwdBxcL545HkksSXGxRlIg.text: Love this place. They don't have the typical all you can eat but the quality of every roll is so good it doesn't matter. The chefs are pretty cool and it's a pretty decent place to watch a game at their bar.

F37keGHY4GG8H9etg9PxQw.text: Moved here from CA about a year ago, and have been trying to find great sushi since we got here- we finally found it! We have tried lots of places, even tried AYCE, and were not impressed until we tried Momo. Started with a few sashimi plates to see how fresh the fish was, and wow was it fresh!  We then tried a couple rolls and some simple sushi and it was all really good. Can't wait to go back! Our server Maria was fantastic too.

IkT0i27hFnKHUZZAKehm6A.text: One of my favorite spots for sushi. Always fresh and always a great experience. The only problem is, I live too far away to be here everyday! I love the MoMo Hamachi. It is a must for me. It melts in your mouth. The service is good and the food is great. What else could you want?

d4Gge_IF4haEkb54ak7_pg.text: this is me and my fiance's favorite sushi restaurant. it makes me sad to see the couple of bad reviews on here. we think the service is great and the food amazing. we always get their specialty roll the momoyama but also try something new every time and its always great. We have a hard time going other sushi places because we like it so much here. Don't pay attention to the bad reviews, test it out yourself. :-)

QUcghOSG4L-0gulumMAozw.text: Came here when my friend and I finished shopping at nordstorm rack. It was our first time in momoyama, our first thought was "its gonna be japanese fast food" coz it did look like one. However, when we got in we were amazed. The inside was actually pretty. Prices were inexpensive, rolls were around 7 - 12 dollars. We got three rolls and 2 appetizers, the appetizers were SMALL. However, the specialty rolls were all good. I highly recommend coming to momoyama after your day at galleria mall or nordstorm rack!  Now I am a fan of your specialty rolls and I will be back soon!

8uMG7ocd7zSu073-CDv8MQ.text: We just had lunch there. It was delicious as always. Its our go to place for sushi. Delicious food at a reasonable price and the service was great.

9cL28bs7vW7sV9K4wEqGSw.text: My first time eating sushi. Decided to come here after i read such good reviews. Let me tell you, this place is a must try place! I highly recommend this to everyone. The service is excellent! No complaints at all. Expect me to come here very often

wMDiDk6GRMd7c1rZ4gLQpg.text: Variety of rolls is killer! White horse was delicious and citrusy. I think another rolls was called "when shrimp meets crab" which was amazing!!! Chef said it was the most popular. The only downside is that this place doesn't have an all you can eat option so the total bill was a bit more expensive. However, I would definitely come back if I wanted just a couple of rolls and not want to stuff myself. I came on a weekday night so it wasn't crowded and service was good.

xRsOp6WF0o_LS8FzAStY7w.text: Still need to dine in but most definatly better than my experience at samurais sushi steak house off of sunset so bad there please go here instead had my cousin pretty much maul my face off for the samurai people giving her salmon since she is allergic this place got my to go orders correct so I was pleased pretty tasty

b8KcmmtlUmpccMu7sXDVtA.text: We love this place.   We've taken a few people here and it is unanimous that the sushi is freshest and best anyone has ever had.  Sit at the sushi bar,  be honest with the sushi chefs, and trust them in making something a little bit more unique for you (if you're not on a super tight budget).  If you're a little bit more careful, the sushi rolls are very filling and very delicious....but the sushi bar experience really is amazing.

K0YArYLJ5JZGFfhiEH9b1A.text: The sushi and sashimi were amazingly delish. I ordered to go and promptly picked up the order. It was well prepared and packaged to look as if they were plated. I was impressed at the attention to detail even with takeout. But more importantly the food was wonderful. The flavors explode in your mouth. Anyways, fresh sushi is the only way to go. It was a little pricey but hey...You're getting fresh food prepared as you order it. We will be back again.

elRHyHNhQ_TOT3Yt6pLk7Q.text: Amazing every single time. Last few times I've got the Irish Roll and found it was the most amazing sushi I've ever had. Chefs are personable and friendly. Best of Las Vegas nominees for sure in the sushi category. I'll be back, of course

UqjS5qgD8vSzzwAx6A2-Nw.text: For a local sushi spot-- this place is great!   The fancy rolls are good, but usually when a place Is all about it's Americanized rolls it's usually because they are hiding the lack I flavor from their fish.  However, simple rolls and Sashimi are amazing too!     My love and I split the sushi boat for two once and that was a gem!   And ASAHI ZERO!!! If you don't drink but want sushi and a beer-- get this non alcoholic treasure!   We keep trying to find it at a store but can only seem to find how to order from Japan! I appreciate them stocking it up!

_7-a8tKypCDwQUvV1jPiTA.text: One of my favorite places to eat good food good service great sushi. Try the Momo box it's wonderful

XuiwW_PR7IJRVDkaFtTPSA.text: Normally I always go to "all you can eat" sushi places only because I like to go and try different rolls. I went to Momos (which does not offer all you can eat and I knew that before going) and WOW what a difference it was from AYCE sushi. The service was amazing and the waitresses always made sure you had water and anything else you needed without being too clingy to the table and trying to get you in and out. The food was delicious and everything the waiter recommended was sooo good! The baked mussels were my favorite but even all of the rolls we had tasted so good! I would HIGHLY recommend this place and will definitely be back soon! It was worth paying more for the taste!

AI-idH2EkWwhkX_ttg6wXw.text: Momo Yama Roll, Mexico City, Screaming Orgasim & Marc's Roll are my top pics at the time being. Johnny, the owner is hilarious and always willing to have some sake if you sit at the bar. :-) Clean establishment with a fun crowd and great staff.

6sPvhjt87ZMnNrAUH8lOIw.text: They place was ok a bit small and crowded but the food was good and great flavor, it was my first time here, staff is ok hard to understand their English.

dNA53VG_zqjCWQ54I92RLQ.text: I go to Momo Sushi about once a month, and I have never left disappointed.   On my most recent visit, for my wedding anniversary, my wife and I shared a couple of rolls, and the Momo Box, which includes teriyaki chicken, rice, 4 sushi rolls, and a few other samples. We spent under $40 on this visit. Not $40 each, but $40 total. I find the prices here to be more than reasonable, especially considering how good the food is.   I've brought several friends here, some of whom could be called sushi snobs, and I've heard nothing but praise for the quality and taste of food served here. The location on Stephanie puts Momo Sushi a quick drive from most of Henderson, and a great alternative to eating at the mall when spending an afternoon there. The ambiance is inviting, and the servers are always friendly.  Be sure to check in on Yelp to get a free dessert!

b_uD3-2u6nkQ5rvl2hqinw.text: What can I say about MoMo.. They really do have some wonderful Sushi! A bit overpriced in some areas, and no AYCE options, but I have never had a bad roll or bad sashimi here. I used to frequent another Henderson sushi restaurant until their quality went downhill (significantly) and my husband introduced me to MoMo. The Irish roll and Something Wrong are some of my favorites, and if you like crispy (fried) sushi, Tara's Fatty is one for you (read: cream cheese and shrimp). The volcano is also very good if you want more crab and less cream cheese.   The wait staff can be spotty at times, but never rude. I have only had one issue with a waitress who made my young son cry, but I have not seen her in there in a while. Anyway, if you go on a busy day (Fridays at dinner and Lunch on the weekdays seem to take the cake) then you might get less than stellar wait service if they are understaffed. However, the food more than makes up for the staffing issues in my opinion. I have been going to MoMo for about 2 years now, and highly recommend it over any other sushi restaurant in Henderson.

9txdma6CteQ5o0X9JRIQ1w.text: To end a day full of shopping with my friend, we decided to get one of my favorite meals: sushi! I'm always open to trying new sushi joints, especially if it's super close to my house! The shopping really built up an appetite for me so I was definitely looking forward to this visit.   This restaurant in the same building as Genghis Grill and the new Baby Stacks restaurants. When you walk into the location, you will notice a couple of things: it's dark and crowded! The waiting area was very small, but once you pass that, you see the sushi bar to the left, for sure a focal point as it's practically the only lit area in the restaurant. To the right was the dining area. Here's what I can say: it's crowded with tables and unnecessary decor. antlers on the walls, fake plants and vines are really outdated and don't really fit the restaurant's personality. The booths had low hanging dim lights and ours was covered in dust. Definitely needs a spring cleaning in there! Our server's name was Megun and she was definitely one with a lot of personality! I was wearing a sriracha shirt, which she noticed and started a conversation from. I really appreciated her attentiveness throughout our meal.   For our late lunch, I wanted to get a hamachi kama. The problem was they ran out of it, so I had to choose something else. Darn! I ended up getting 4 orders of the Hamachi Nigiri for $4.50 an order (2 pieces per order) and 2 orders of the tako for $4.25 per order. One thing that threw me off about this place was the fact that they didn't offer the All You Can Eat option. That meant my meal was going to be pricey for not a lot of stuff. For the food, I thought it was just alright. The hamachi was pink in color, pinker than I'm used to. Made me think if that was super fresh or just a different part of the fish. It was good though. What I did not like, however, was the fact that they put wasabi between the rice and fish. That was new and a complete surprise as it stung my nose! LOL. Be advised, you do not need wasabi in your soy sauce.  There's already wasabi in the sushi, and lots of it! The tako (octopus) was the same with the wasabi. I thought the flavor and texture was consistent with what I often times get, so no surprises there, it was very good.   For me, this was hard. When I go to restaurants looking for sushi, I'm looking to get a lot of it. To pay the same amount as I would for an All You Can Eat meal at another restaurant, I really didn't get a lot of food. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying something else, but if it's sushi, I would probably opt to go to a sushi joint with an AYCE option. Thanks Momo, though, for the experience. I appreciate it!

CeK05W1JsZFp9MLdc89oZg.text: I wanted to find something close to home and last time I had momo I enjoyed it so I decided to come back tonight. The boyfriend and I ordered 10 pieces of gyoza [he's in love with gyoza, if the restaurant has it on the menu, he's automatically ordering it]. Gyoza was alright, I would give it a 4/5. We also ordered kalbi which came with rice and miso soup and priced at $15. Kind of pricey but it was cooked quite well. Very flavorful and came on a sizzling plate like at typical Korean restaurants. For sushi we ordered salmon, kanpachi, uni, and the hooter's roll. The fresh wasabi they put on the fish has a kick to it so be careful with that. Salmon was good, but you can't usually go wrong with salmon unless it's too fishy smelling. I was a bit disappointed in their kanpachi. I usually love kanpachi but it was sliced quite thin so I could barely taste it. The uni here is always good!! I'd definitely recommend it. And the hooter's roll was like the cucumber protein roll but with radish instead of cucumber wrapped around it. It was refreshing but I think I prefer cucumber instead of radish. Overall, I'd go again and I'd recommend this place for sushi if you wanted something around this area.

k-9w4CeKClL3K816MqkMJw.text: Two stars are for the sushi itself. It was great quality. The service was okay at first. Until we had a problem then we got dirty looks from the elder lady (owner maybe?). TYPICALLY when I order nigiri, from literally every sushi place I've ever been at, there's no wasabi on the rice. If they do, then they usually ASK if it's okay. (My aunt confirmed that they usually remind their guests about the wasabi but forgot to do so this time). I don't like wasabi, it ruins my sushi for me personally. So I bit into my nigiri & was disappointed to find wasabi in it, I checked all my other pieces and realized there was wasabi in all of it. So I  nicely told our waitress that I didn't like wasabi and didn't realize they would have it in their nigiri. She seemed to brush it off saying "you should've said something first" and walked away. I thought she would fix the problem for me, but after a while asked another lady if I was going to get a new plate since I couldn't eat wasabi. She went and told the sushi chefs right away (yay! Stoked, because I honestly really like their fish). I ended up getting my nigiri and quickly finished it and we got out of there as soon as possible. I didn't really want to tip the waitress, but my aunt did so anyways. Even tho we got an eye roll and multiple dirty looks. Whatever, I tipped and thanked the sushi chefs separately for the trouble, it's not their fault the waitress didn't do her job properly. Won't be returning though because of the rude service.

hqPRoidOEalIQFnxvrExdw.text: I absolutely love this place the waitresses were great ans nice to my daughter and they had football on the food was amazing such fresh fish!!!!

EgvLBfq5q_7YCgFEH_FJDg.text: I've only been here once but I had a great experience!  My friend and I came and ordered the nigiri special with one roll, and another roll a la carte. The rolls were good. Standard good rolls from a sushi restaurant but nothing spectacular.    What blew my socks off was the nigiri!  It was so fresh and delicious!  In vegas you have a lot of all you can eat sushi so the nigiri you get there is kind of ehhhh.... Either too much rice, or the fish is not fresh.... Or something about it is just off.  But this is not an all you can eat sushi place. The quality was very good. The coloring, the butteriness of the fish, the soft texture, everything was on point. Nigiri special changes daily as its up to the chefs choice.   I don't eat in Henderson often by im glad I came here.  They also have great beer on draft and happy hour as well!

jVFl7pX2WIlvrY8j8-MkXw.text: I would give Momo Sushi more stars if the service matched the food.  I will be straightforward by saying that the service is horrible. The ladies who work there are extremely grouchy and inattentive. I have given them plenty of chances to change my opinion in the last 6 months and it just hasn't gotten any better. I have to add that I am always friendly to servers and I try to be understanding, so for me to be dissatisfied with service is worth listening to.  Now the food...  The food is pretty good. The sushi is fresh (although could use more variety - a lot of cooked rolls) and the bento boxes/dinner plates are a good option for non-sushi eaters (particularly the kalbi short ribs).The servings are generous and most days good food is enough to get me to come back.

-OmBBqgrg-VwmLlW_5DIyw.text: The momos on Stephanie is my friends and I'd go-to for sushi. The sushi is amazing every time and I've been there many many times. James is our guy!! He always does an amazing and quick job behind the counter. He also turns fruits into animals or characters haha!

3O-1T992vXyKQDoOadeCRA.text: Let's have some MO... Momo Sushi. An appropriate name for this place, Momo (more more) Sushi. What an awesome sushi place for lunch or dinner on this side of Henderson.   The location is kind of odd as you don't really see it from Stephanie. The whole strip mall is not even facing the main road, it's awkwardly sideways. Just pull into the driveway past Marie Calendars and it will be on your left side.  So yes, the food here is awesome especially the Agadashi tofu. I've had this dish numerous times and I really do appreciate the presentation at Momo. The tofu is cut up in nice bite size pieces and sitting inside a bowl of broth. At other places the tofu is cut larger. When it's served larger so many awkward things can happen. 1) you cut it with your chopsticks and the crispy glaze breaks off. 2) you bite into it and you look like a Neanderthal with food dropping out of your mouth. 3) other embarrassing moments that should be left alone. The pieces at Momo were perfect!!  The rolls were so good. If you like tuna try the ultimate tuna roll. Spicy tuna with tuna on top, sitting in a spicy garlic type sauce/ oil. So good and the sauce keeps it moist!   So yes, whenever I get my nails done at Euphora I'm high tailing to Momo for lunch... For MOre sushi and Agadashi tofu.  Oh don't forget to check in on Yelp! We received free green tea ice cream! YAY!

EfEf6FOxSB1sx4W9sphEUw.text: I have lived in Vegas for 6 years and I never found a sushi restaurant I loved until my friend Lucas brought me here.   Ditch the low quality all you can eat sushi and come here if you want good and fresh quality fish.   We sat at the bar and James and Eric was our sushi chef. Fantastic and great chefs and I love when they give recommendations. Complimentary cucumber salad was brought out along with the usual ginger and wasabi.   What to order Hamachi sashimi with a jalapeno and a hint of Siracha. Not too spicy and the right amount of citrus.   Toro: By far my favorite nigiri - the fatty tuna belly. Most places don't have this and I didn't see it on the menu so just ask for it!  Uni shooter: Came in a martini glass. I'm a huge fan of uni.   Spicy halibut: with a hint of siracha and green onion.   Also here's a tip. Ask James for his "Happy Orange" dessert. *hint hint wink wink. It's actually quite clever.   5 stars for service and food.

I6QcOp0hvap4jV0igD3ZiA.text: I have eaten at Momo Sushi twice now, both for lunch. It would have been three times but the last time I tried to go for dinner it was packed. Momo definitely does the trick when I am in the mood for a little bit of sushi. Unfortunately, that is rarely the case, because when it comes to delicious raw fish, I like to stuff my face like a fatty. This is why I tend to go for sushi places that offer all you can eat...   On my first visit I wasn't super hungry and had plans for dinner later that evening, so I just stopped in for a snack. The sushi chefs were nice and the tuna nigiri had great texture and flavor. I did find service to be a little lacking, I had to ask the sushi chef to get a waitress to refill my water, and had a bit of a wait to get the check.   On my second visit I was very hungry. I ended up ordering edemame, a roll, as well as tuna and scallop nigiri. The sushi chef convinced me to go with the live scallop which was delicious.. but I wish I had known in advance it was going to cost me three times the price of the regular scallops.   Pros: Large and interesting rolls to choose from Friendly sushi chefs Above average fish quality  Cons: Can get pricey quick with no option for ACYE Waitress service is slow and not attentive enough On the small side  Since I live fairly close and am often in the area to run errands, there is a decent change I will go back to Momo Sushi at some point. Chances are I will drive a little farther and go someplace that offers more fishy bang for my buck though!

h_tseOcYV1_MYHt92kD5xw.text: We come to Momo's for dinner at least twice a month.  The food is great, the sushi fresh and the staff friendly.  Our go to Japanese restaurant!

m0okDrOdW6lj_cf2GW38eg.text: The food here is so amazing!  The have quality ingredients. They have many dishes that you cannot find at an AYCE.  To top it all off, the customer service is nothing short of EXCELLENT!  Oh and the 2 for 1 sake?  DONE.

yK72jzceypbauSKIiKNePw.text: The sushi was delicious. The Jennifer 2 was extremely good. I ordered 2 rolls. The only downfall was the service. 1cD1PnO30TxOxA2h8DzvnA.text: Great place with great sushi and service. Came here with my girlfriend, we usually do the all you can eat places. This was extraordinary compared to all the sushi places we've had around here in Las Vegas. Love the vibe and food; definitely recommend it! Niki served us and was super friendly and helped us out.

vJnHS-MADkkKsoMPRZt7ng.text: I've been here a few times now and both times have thoroughly enjoyed myself. When it comes to sushi, I don't do rolls or fried crap so a place needs to offer something special for me to be impressed. Here are some of the things I've loved...  (1) Service. Both times the service has been great and the chefs have been fairly chatty. I really got to know the guy the last time I went. (2) Baby Octopus Salad - This dish is just yummy. Healthy strips of baby octopus with sesame seeds and not sure what else but I scarf it down. (3) Uni shooter. I love an Uni Shooter so if a place offers it I'm in. (4) Live Shrimp - I first discovered this awesome treat in CA. They cut the live shrimp in front of you and serve you the tail meat. They then take the head, flash fry it, and you eat it. SOOOOOOO sweet and yummy! (5) They always have specials. I love a place that offers stuff off the menu. It shows they care and are trying to be inventive.  I'm not sure why there are bad reviews but they were all from a while back so maybe things have improved. Of all the places I've been in Las Vegas, outside of say Tao or Yellowtail type places, this is by far my favorite. It definitely makes a happy ending to an afternoon of shopping.

YejiNaiZfeop0ygFfwi3bg.text: This place is a whole in the wall. Food is fresh and of very good quality. pJnetOPLpZ758QFb1j5PEg.text: Went here today with some friends. We arrived at lunch time and had a big group, 10 people, but surprisingly this place was pretty empty. So we were seated right away. We usually go to AYCE places, but the pricing here for not being AYCE was very reasonable and the food was of high quality. We had 1 lunch bento that came with miso soup, side salad, 2 entree items (chicken teriyaki and kalbi was what we ordered) and rice. We also ordered 3 rolls, and age dashi and the "rolls rice ball" and our bill came to $59. The "rolls rice ball" was amazing, was rice with fish and sauce mixed in, so a roll in a place. All the other rolls were very tasty as well. Definitely will go back to this place to try more items. I had to knock off some points though for the service. The waitress sighed and rolled her eyes when we said it would be 3 separate tabs, and she seemed to have a hard time keeping the orders straight. The other thing she did, which kind of shocked us all, was when asking if my friend wanted a refill, she grabbed the glass from her while she was mid drink to go refill it. Right out of her hand. My husband told me later that another waitress apologized for her and said that she was upset because 2 servers called out sick so she was called in. Sorry but that's her issue, one that shouldn't be taken out on the customer. Hopefully the service will be better next trip.

vJppJvacK5RjrYHt2VLehQ.text: Stopped in at Momo's because of the great reviews and was not disappointed. The miso soup was great, followed by the Henry and Orion rolls. Will definitely come by here again next time I'm in town!

KrjyEyGgkJk0x8N2zu0Jiw.text: "It's okay to eat fish, because they don't have any feelings..." - Kurt Cobain  I love fish...raw, seared, roasted, deep fried, smoked, whatever. But I have yet to find a "go to" spot here in the valley for good sashimi and sushi. When the wife and I lived down near the east side of Trop, we used to go to Sushi On Tropicana. It was a really good AYCE place, unfortunately it closed. Since moving to Henderson, we have been trying various locations that are just "meh". But, we keep coming back to Momo Sushi. They aren't an all-you-can-eat kind of place, but that's okay, their fish is pretty damned good...fresh, well prepared, delicious.  Located down on Stephanie, right next to Baby Stacks Cafe (excellent breakfast, BTW), right across from Burlington Coat Factory. Very unassuming and dark when you walk in, until you hear the familiar "irasshaimase!" greeting from the sushi chefs...good sized sushi bar and smallish dining room beside it. They do have booths, though. Waitresses are friendly and quick with the drink order, which is nice.  Before I met my wife, I would usually order my sushi nigiri and by the piece...she's introduced me to the world of specialty rolls, spicy mayo and sweet sauces...why not? (Still getting used to the cream cheese thing, though). Momo has an array of specialty rolls, like most places, difference being, these are pretty good sized rolls (maybe making up for the fact they don't do AYCE sushi?). Most are priced in the mid-range of between $8.95 and $14.95.  The wife's favorite is, of course, the Screaming Orgasm (insert girlish giggle here...), seared tuna piled around a mountain of shredded daikon radish surrounded by a moat of spicy garlic ponzu sauce and mayo. Get the large, it's good. My favorites are the Spider Roll, I love soft-shell crab...and the Something Wrong 69 roll, more soft-shell crab with shrimp tempura, topped with an assortment of fish (a little bit of everything, iz oishii). If I still have room at the end of the meal, I'll sometimes skip the mochi ice cream and get the Zaru Soba (buckwheat noodles, served cold). I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it on the menu, it's the perfect way to finish a meal.  So, I don't know if I've found my "go-to" spot yet...but, Momo Sushi is close. If your looking for a good izakaya restaurant/sushi joint, check it out...I just noticed they have Hamachi Kama on the menu, will have get that next time...I love a nice fatty piece of broiled or grilled fish collar.

PrVGoITqLmiBb59lMLcZMQ.text: Went for the first time at Momo Sushi and I am not impressed and happy with their customer  service. For a Sushi lover, I have eaten and visited a lot of Sushi establishments in different states and here at home. The food is good but the service lacked. When we arrived the reception from the staff was very strained. It's as if sating "hello" or "welcome" was too much work for them.  We were sat by the server and each of us were given menus. Since it was our first time, we were reading, very carefully the menu so we can make good decisions in what to eat. Server came to take our orders more than once. I told her we needed more time but she kept coming back really fast without allowing us to have time to decide. We felt rushed.  After we ordered and our food delivered, you'd think that they will come back to check up on us and see if we needed our glasses re-filled with our beverages. No one did that. I was parched and I had to get someone's attention to get my glass of water refilled. Could it be that I only had water and not Soda or an alcoholic beverage? Whatever the reason, I feel that I shouldn't have to flag someone that many times to get my glass of beverage refilled.  The food was good but I've eaten better in other establishments that are cheaper who also gave us better service than they.  The place is simply not friendly and welcoming.  To return to this place will not happen again. Not a  recommendation to anyone.  I give them two thumbs down.

43_ZNNfS78T6tVRCmYlxTQ.text: This sushi restaurant is one of the best you'll find in Henderson! Top notch rolls, excellent presentation and their lunch and dinner specials are unbelievable! I've been coming here for as long as I can remember and will never stop!

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Lunch Special

e7AGhU4r_nQAcpJD0XXRQg.text: Momo sushi...thank you for introducing me to the bento boxes.  Can't get a better deal than that!  I love this place.  I lived way across town.  But when I do get the craving, no doubt I pay my homage to you.

TVaCOfh3h50ToxcpdCjnlg.text: I never realy cared for sushi until I visited this place. My favorite is the Ugly Roll with yum yum sauce. The employees are great too.

DMEmC3VQ90ZNHkGsL2p_JA.text: It's not all you can eat but not better ten a lot of the all you can eat place I've been to. Get more bang for your buck and go to another all you can eat.

mzeODsKwJQs_7QFMQS9C_g.text: My friend and I are always on a search for good sushi bars in Vegas and this is my personal favorite. And they have the best Screaming O' (orgasm) in town. Their food is always quality and their costumer service is pretty good. Fair warning, the low/no sodium and their regular soy sauce are the same.

iVD_pwJEANs3C94VrGqL-g.text: It was decent and not crowded. The quality is good, the service a bit slow. We at at the Bar and chef was attentive. He even made the crab nigiri we asked for. I gave it two stars because there are others that, when I eat sushi, I can't stop saying "mm". This place didn't have that oomph for me, unfortunately.

P381MZI2hvkcXO4EQBr5lw.text: great sushi, great alternative if you do not want to do AYCE

CC1j1u8jVN-TA4sle4SSUg.text: I think we tried some of the more non traditional rolls, which is why I am only giving 3 stars. The rolls are good and its closer to our house but its not the best sushi I've ever had. We tried the irish roll, palm tree roll, and volcano roll. The Irish roll is somewhat odd tasting because of the liquidy sauce on it. Just an odd taste so neither of us liked it. My wife liked the palm tree roll and I really liked the volcano roll. I would recommend it to friends and will go back and try a few more rolls because overall it was good, and theres a huge selection of rolls.

KoX1lEALXl9rNwang638yA.text: Service was great, people were friendly, and the sushi was excellent!!  And I've been looking for a good place since moving out here, so I have been several places locally already!  This is the only place I will definitely come back to and will do so regularly!

M0ej85gN8-qdLXD1lAe4fQ.text: Momo Sushi is above the rest!!! We have been coming here for years, and have NEVER had a bad experience. We live SOOOO far from it now, but still make time to stop by anytime we are on this side of town! We've tried a lot of different sushi spots trying to find something closer, but after u've had momo it is so hard to settle for anything else!! Our favorite rolls: Irish roll, Mexico City Roll, Ugly Roll. WE LOVE MOMO!!!

xJX-NFK-LlikMqxFQPmVWA.text: I've been here twice for dinner and once for take out. All three times the sushi is yummy. They have some pretty imaginative rolls. Staff is very friendly, although once our service was very slow and both times eating in the table and benches have been sticky. Let's hope that doesn't have anything to do with how clean their kitchen is.

QX8xW-n_qGYYocU1bVbRyg.text: They sushi chefs are so friendly and their sushi is amazing I tired their Irish roll, and thought it was amazing

s_mroJyHwnmyfjQE0mOtoA.text: Fast and friendly service. Had a yelp voucher and they were happy to accept it. Fair priced and the sushi rolls were yum! Would recommend.

B5HLMxm0qZxVGxKsNS5qUQ.text: We had an exceptional lunch. Wonderful food. The shrimp tempura was the best I have ever had. My husband had the Combo A spicy tuna roll. Everything was fresh and beautifully presented. The hostess (owner?) was cheerful and responsive. The atmosphere was comfortable. We will definitely return.

DdLLVI6nLAwsnjMSZrHyzQ.text: Went for lunch.  My second time there.  Waited 25 minutes for one roll.  Waitress said there was a miscommunication between her & the chef.  Asked to have some food boxed up.  Waitress took the plate & never came back with the box of left overs.  She said she threw it away.  Manager said the best they could do is $2.00 off the bill.  Oh, and I overheard the next booth complaining & wanting to see the manager. Never again Momo!!!!!!

IHWirpD1PMQMF4AIzBkP4A.text: Our favorite place for sushi in Las Vegas.  Everything we have ordered here is excellent and fresh!  Clean and great service.  Go there immediately!

oUKLhEWOAsTRVqwUCnBrkw.text: Ok, first of, this is a Japanese restaurant owned by Koreans, so you can start imagine the authentic quality of the "sushi" there.  Friends and I got there hoping that this newly opened restaurant could add a golden star of the day, but oh boy was I wrong... The waitor was so rude and the food was awful comparing with some of the good authentic sushi restaurants in town. This is definitely a no-go, go waste your money somewhere else.

cQx6NmdCFJoRcWNj7M0FJw.text: The girlfriend and I came here looking fo some good sushi. Its pretty good kind of expensive for what I thought it was worth. The service there is acceptable

ypwP60YJ_QbsnKkc0vvW1A.text: I had a Rest com coupon so was able to convince my husband to go for lunch.... ( he usually only wants to go to AYCE sushi.) He had the Lunch Special ($8.95) with the Miso soup, other sides, chicken teriyaki and chicken katsu. He thought both chickens were very good, the teriyaki chicken was not fatty and was tender & moist. He loved the Miso soup, thought it was one of the best he had tried at local places. He also had ebi, magura and hamachi nigiri, and thought all tasted fresh. I had the usual embarrassingly named rolls and they were quite tasty. When the older sushi chef had to tell the other chef to make the S on the B roll, they both giggled and shook their heads.... but I got past it and it was good eating! I had been so focused on the menu, that I didn't look up and see the daily special board right in front of me until after ordering... I will be back to try some of those. We sat at the sushi bar and enjoyed watching the chefs create the plates, er.. boats. One boat was made with a fish he filleted as we watched. The final product had what was left of the fish as adornment. Looks much better than it sounds.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Sushi Boat with Daily Special board behind

fXNZ-3MT92I79r5-7Ho4uA.text: I am going here Saturday night with the 'rents. So I will write more about this place later but this review will be on the 3 times in the past I've been here.  This place is freakin' awesome :)  Staff - friendly, fast: food - fresh, amazing ;) These people have it down!  They have this particular roll I love but I cannot remember the name (Tina's fatty roll??)  when I eat there Sat I'll (of course) get it & write about it some more ;) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Damn parents & I didn't go on Sat so I'll never get the name of that roll!!!  WAHHHHH!

onS08RnUyM9DzJTvNzdu9w.text: We have tried a few sushi restaurants in the Henderson area since it's nice and close to Boulder City.  The best by far is Momo's.  The staff is so friendly, every roll we have had is fresh and flavorful.  We keep trying others, but none of them exceed the quality of Momo's.

dXhPBmhiicJKQ86tTGFH6g.text: So bummed. I used to love this place, it's right by me and I used to go all the time. Haven't been in months so we went again and it was no bueno. The rice was mushy and the rolls, I don't know, just not like they used to be. It's a shame, and I hope it was a fluke, but the most recent time was not great.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

sO9vb1aszMobCDCP100UTg.text: I always wondered about this sushi spot when I was eating at Babystacks or Genghis so yesterday I finally ventured in. The verdict? It's okay, not outstanding, but not bad either.  For Saturday at lunch we found the restaurant to be pretty empty and we were quickly seated at a booth. I started with Edamame that wasn't good, possibly even bad. It didn't seem fresh. My other starter was a Green Salad and I absolutely loved the ginger dressing on top. My husband and I shared three rolls. We ordered the Mexico City, Hawaiian, and Shrimp Tempura. My favorite was the Hawaiian, but overall we liked all three.   The service was mediocre. The waitress was sweet, but she seemed very frazzled even though the restaurant wasn't busy. We had to order my husband's Sprite twice and it seemed like she thought it was a new order instead of something she forgot about. After all the food arrived sans salad I had to ask for my salad a second time. She was about to take our order and ran away mid-sentence before returning to take our order. Other tables were walking back to the kitchen to ask for forgotten items too. I kind of felt bad for her because she seemed totally out of it. Maybe it was just an off day.   Overall, the rolls were decent, but the service left a little to be desired.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Mexico City &amp; Shrimp Tempura
Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Hawaiian Roll

JIH5H8YhAZ2cHKkOVLtIFg.text: I ordered the large chef choice sashimi and got a 12 pieces of not so tasty sashimi. Very thick cut so I have to bite each piece in half. The presentation was not very good as the sashimi was placed on coarsely shredded radish and the radish were stuck to the fish making it hard to get a clean piece of fish. Very skimpy on the ginger and when I asked for more the chef wasn't too happy. They did not bother to check if I like the food or needed anything during the meal. Won't come back.

rcH_U3HTzlMBk_ZX3ELcOQ.text: Pretty decent sushi. Fish was definitely fresh! However the rolls didn't stay together very well. So they all fell apart. One thing I didn't like they don't have sashimi on their menu. They have about two options that are essentially a sashimi dish but I don't want to pay $14-18 and get 8 of the same fish. I want variety. Restraint had a decent amount of people in there but they all ordered boxes instead of sushi....

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

S0PhGiicK_OgG-2XqQ5XJg.text: Excellent sushi, welcoming staff and great prices.  We arrived here around 8:15 pm one night and we were seated right away.   The waitresses here are very nice and efficient.  My husband and I ordered 3 rolls and a side of edamame to share.  Each roll that came out was delicious and hit the spot.  I'm pretty sure anything that you order from them will be good.  The price is right too.  Our bill came to about 45 dollars which was a deal considering we originally were going to eat at a sushi restaurant on the Strip where just one roll would have been $45.  If you are ever on this side of town make sure you give this place a try.

933E3hGAO7qLGU_DRrdyJg.text: I ordered dinner special $24.95 for the special roll and 7 sushi of chef's selection. Portions of fish are generous. Everything is so tasty. Great quality (hand down)

ZmX0rpIoVwHC-PZU29dKEw.text: My favorite local sushi place! We usually come for early or late dinners since it can get busy. I've never had a bad meal and the service is polite and timely.

lEJ48u96UzjcjWvhGpD3kA.text: You can't compare this restaurant to an all you can eat sushi spot..  The Chefs are super nice! The food is delicious!!! And the service is great!  We love the 2 for 1 sake most of all though!

XiZuRLjQCAjLXTdKIRZoTg.text: This place is delicious never fails and NUTHING is better then sirting at the bar and watching them make magic!

Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. We had the white horse sushi roll and the oriental grilled chicken salad!! So delish! At least once a month we come here!!

g2TcTZ__O-Sr-UMaHSZCnw.text: What a great little gem! Super nice sushi chef, James, along with some very fresh fish, bogo sake = perfect birthday place for me.

HCFwEX3ffmsWmstqd7nGDw.text: Delicious food, the sushi was fresh and they have a great variety. Buy one get one free sake everyday (score) and they were so kind to our kids. The prices are high for this area, and the food didn't taste all that great. The quality of fish for the sushi is decent but generally not a good cut of fish. The hamachi was a bit stiff and stringy. We did get the Sushi boat to share and that thing was huge for $50. Our bill was pretty high and we didn't feel like we got a lot of food.   The rolls were ok. Service was ok, pretty mediocre.   I think I'd get the same quality if not better quality at an AYCE place down the street. Most likely not coming back.

KoXIfU0Te7mTrMn-r7KugQ.text: Love love love this place. Came here for a late lunch with my son, his girlfriend and my big brother. My son has been here before but a first for me. I ate way to much but loved every bite. Everything was very fresh an spot on. Everything we had from the spicy edamame to the rolls an even the teriyaki chicken were sooo yummy. The prices were reasonable an the service was perfect. We sat at the sushi bar which I like as you just order what you want. I know Its a drive but I will definitely go back. I'm so glad my son suggested to go there.

hfRHjb5UW2Cs_kIuJ0gpkA.text: Great selection of rolls Not too pricey So far, the best roll for me is WHEN SHRIMP MEAT CRAB - a must try!!!   Will definitely come back.

sinLO_NhS-L_ReJsY71lzg.text: This is a good places to go. I would go here again. Just did not like that they had change me two time on my credit card.

B9WCaYrTADuLMOb93Xd1eA.text: Momo Sushi is always a good choice for lunch. Stopped in over the weekend and had a roll with some bento boxes. Everything was delicious as usual. We will be back again for lunch. Never been here for dinner but perhaps we will come in sometime to try.

nee66Nzq9yJ46P0mpWVh6A.text: I was extremely hungry, but not to the point I would eat something that isn't fresh. The rice was hard and  color of the albacore was questionable. I ate two pieces and I think I'm nauseous?!! Even the tempura appetizers were gooey and doughy. Money wasted

DnIY3lO1Ti96E-lSSTlL5Q.text: Momo Sushi is your standard neighborhood restaurant, suitable for a quick eat after shopping. We had miso soup, tuna nigiri, some special spicy roll, and ice cream.   Some noticeable traits: the lighting does not work well with the menus, as the glare makes the reading uncomfortable, and my ice cream was partially melted. Another interesting characteristic is that the fish on the nigiri seems lengthy compared to the rice. It's not hugging the mound of rice, like most, but instead trails off both ends. It doesn't mean anything, I suppose, it just looks different.

b9q16DTjqhR6wFlZo3M8nw.text: I eat here at least once a week! I love there Philadelphia roll and their prices are very reasonable! Nice staff also!

gmhpSV25N2DBWQ8O_aQbHQ.text: The food is good.  The food comes quickly, but otherwise the service is miserable.  The waitresses are slow, the refills have to be requested, and if you ask for no ice they forget on subsequent refills.  The worst part is the price; it is way overpriced... possibly the most expensive sushi in Vegas.  There are many better places that give you more bank for your buck.  Overall, an average place at best, but extremely overpriced.  Based on pricing, I would not return.

QhkkGNbB-_5H4TyBEF94Xw.text: Service: This, in combination with the food, is why I rate this place with 4 stars. The servers were so kind, polite, and prompt. We also loved the miso soup at the beginning of our meal and the scoop of ice cream at the end. Our drinks were refreshed and they had a smile on their face each time they came by. Yes were full !

kkuLh29qWSyOjJg0h6aNxg.text: So when I walked into this place they were jammed packed with two servers on the floor. Andrew realized we did not even have our drinks and we had been there for a good 10 minutes. He promptly came to our table and offered a booth. We took that offer. Not only was the food on point but the service was even better ! Thanks Andrew I'm so full and satisfied.. the desert was the topper. See y'all soon!

RfLw4zeB_U-YMGj-ENWyHA.text: Stopped in here for lunch yesterday, and since we had recently had sushi, we opted for the bento box. The lunch was fantastic! I had the bento with shrimp tempura and mackeral, and my son had the kalbi and chicken katsu. Everything was really good, however, the kalbi and the tempura were my favorites.

gAmvLnw9JCL3XGsDV93-UQ.text: Not too bad, it's no Kaizen, but it's ok.  Location is good for me. But the restaurant is a little outdated but the service is very mediocre

4RdpttCQbnR4d-EtVOvWjA.text: Service was and always is great. Andrew was my server and he was super attentive and awesome. I live down the street and this place may be a weekly stop for me

dli851iQu_YE523jcdU3SQ.text: This is one of our favorite lunch spots. They have a lunch platter that you can choose what items you would like. We've never had a bad combination. You also get miso soup with your lunch.

SsDBICRdtrrRmUPtEy_9yg.text: This is hands down my favorite sushi bar in Henderson. I've been coming here twice a month for the past year and it never disappoints. Johnny and Simon always take excellent care of my family at the sushi bar. Must try items are the momo kanpachi special, white tuna paradise, live shrimp and fresh spicy halibut.

lA37bbmJeshz104R5OwH2w.text: Great service, menu and variety. The sushi is fresh and always delicious. My go to place for sushi in the Henderson area.

9BQOr5args6ydHxyxeN52Q.text: Came sometime last week with my god daughter and best friend. We sat at the sushi bar, they don't have AYCE but pretty decent sushi and it's filling so ala carte works just fine! Great service, employees were all very nice and our server and sushi chef were especially kid friendly. Our server forgot one of my orders, but it's okay because I ended up so full anyway.   Also, If you check in and order an entree you get a free Cali roll, worked perfect since the little one loves noodles and sushi.   Overall good experience and I did like their Saba sushi (huge Saba fan!) so I would most definitely return.

mtqXrr7OmdUBkUcutRxqRw.text: Momo's is amazing! Great food and atmosphere! I've been a loyal diner since they opened. The soft shell crab wrapped in hamachi is glorious!

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

D_j7DBO9j0PMIf2xYBwNVw.text: Well, it's official guys!  I can finally stop staying "there's no good Japanese places near me in Henderson!"  cause this place was damn good! haha. Now I don't know if my palate has changed (highly doubt that) but the spicy tuna was so damn good!  It had the perfect blend of flavors with the right amount of kick, if you know what I mean!  And if you want to go for a big bang, you can get it extra spicy! =D    I ordered the salmon skin salad, Orion Roll and the Jesty Roll.  Salmon Skin Salad:  Mmmm...the skin was crispy!  And the dressing was good!  None of that soggy salmon skin crap you get at some places.  Highly recommended! =)    Orion Roll:  Momo's edition of spicy tuna roll topped with albacore tuna and drizzled with a garlic sauce.  Very delicious!  Rice was perfect, not too mushy, and not too undercooked!  Yum!!    Jesty Roll:  Salmon rolled in masago, rolled up in rice, topped with more salmon and a thinly sliced lemon!  Super good for that refreshing taste you sometimes crave! =)    The only down side to this place is it is a bit pricey.  I was bit upset at first, but once that spicy tuna hit my taste buds, they were dancing with joy and the price didn't matter anymore! haha.    Check it out guys! =)

gmp7doiH6gF8MK0rWcDz5w.text: STILL the best $14 eat in Nevada by far! Excellent pricing, excellent quality, excellent prep.....really nice ppl as well....including Greg K. who turned be on to Settabello ...another winner.  CES 2017 - returned as usual and as usual STILL the very best priced eats one can expect, great ambiance, great food, good wine, great prices.... ALWAYS top recommendation.

WYDbfv6V0AwWSPcdYUwMNQ.text: If the fish is gray throw it away, I think they said this at the OJ Simpson trial, but the same sentiment should be said here. YUCK! Don't waste your money.

wbhUNrN3yzltjCu_YYJSyA.text: We are from out of town, yet felt like we were at home here! The wife got trashed with sushi chef James and we finished up with the mango sakitini. Absolute greatness! Some of the best sushi I've ever had! The presentation was beautiful and amazing! The staff was so, so friendly and kind. So fun to drink with too!

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. Yellowtail and octopus sashimi. Best I&#39;ve ever had! So beautiful too!

Jjn665xE9eeew817eo2QmA.text: I visited here for the first time recently, I was impressed with the flavors of the rolls and the quality of the food. The atmosphere is a bit lacking, and I felt the price was too high. Overall it's a very good place for sushi, but you can definitely get the same quality for a better price.

4DtWnrLn06PvNFtZZztznQ.text: I absolutely LOVE this place!  Fresh food, friendly and fun staff, and then there is the Ultimate Tuna Roll...the best thing I have ever eaten.  Ever.  Anywhere. They have a big variety of rolls to choose from, so finding something that calls to you isn't hard to do...not over-eating is the hard part.

pmu5kv0i2acozYNz008Kvg.text: This is my favorite Japanese restaurant in the Las Vegas/Henderson area. The California roll is delicious. I don't eat sashimi, so I can't be a judge of that, but the other food I have had there is consistently delicious. I love the Momo Box and have it almost every time I come here.

VrA-iGdXmbgpGas46q134w.text: Everyone here is very nice. Sit at the bar and enjoy sushi that is unbeatable in Vegas. For the price, you won't find better quality fish. I bring coworkers from all over the country to this location. Haven't found anything better in my year here and it's close to what I've had in Vista, CA.

QgYhDzu5_jt1DWAYO11BOA.text: we tried this place based on reviews.  we already love sumo sushi over on green valley and wanted to see if this place measured up.  nope.  didn't cut it.  good but not great.  went there trhee times to make sure but we'll stick to sumo for our love of sushi!

zXB3GIzQ__ZFEl_PcZX3Dg.text: i have been going to momo sushi for years!! the staff is always friendly, the owner julie is great, and i have literally not found anything on the menu i didnt like. sooooo good. it's mouthwatering delicious!!:-)

VEqK9Wg_EqxrPa78JSF28w.text: I liked the atmosphere here.  The service was excellent and fast.  I will definitely be back.  I usually opt for all-you-can eat, but if you want a nicer, sit-down place, I recommend here.

EBAiLECK6UYgsQvoVSQvog.text: The drive is a pain in the butt from my house, but it's SO worth it. I ordered salmon and miso soup, and it was out of this world. I got it as a carry out, and I was so pleased that everything was fresh and the soup was hot when I got home to enjoy it. Friendly staff, clean establishment. I'll definitely go back again.

uEOnRo7CyZBuwuhehfzUgg.text: I went here for Dinner, yesterday. I ordered simple things. Salmon and Albacore Nigiri and a Eel Roll. This should have been an easy one. The waiters were pleasant. The only redeeming quality Well, I first got the Salmon. It was dry and slightly Chewy. Then came the Albacore. Or should I say, partially seared, Albacore. For some reasonm they decide to sear it, without making it clear, on the menu. Otherwise I wouldn't have ordered it. The thing I love about Albacore, is the melt in your mouth texture. This was Crap! I couldn't eat my order, This presentation of Sushi destroyed my desire for Sushi, for a couple months. I will not return here, as there are better places, not far. They should be ashamed.

lKMTzCdkGn08SPcPE_jQmQ.text: The service was horrible!  We were the only table and got decent service then a crowd of rowdy women came in and we were nonexistent.  It took us over 30 min to get our check and that was after I  had to walk up to the front counter.  The food was decent but will probably not go back. I don't like to be in an establishment where I'm treated like I'm a bother than welcomed.  Being a prior food server I was very disappointed at the quality of service.

Q_9nOQ5Rd5424PP7fiuCSQ.text: Great sushi !!Nicky our waitress was very sweet !!food was great and fresh.The fish was excellent and was able to try new items..

YUZVjwcDVBgBULXUs5w8kg.text: First time here and was well pleased with the service. Andrew and Megan were quick to answer questions I had on some of the sushi rolls. Kiss of Fire was delicious. The plum ice cream was very tasty as well. I would come again.

wtGXR7XGJRANhDmCr5r6ag.text: Been here quite a few times now and decided to write a review for the awesome service and response from Andrew and Megan. The chirashi bowl was very good quality, and it is just amazing find here in Henderson !

63DQWFdQMnJ7zg5faEKc4w.text: Great food!  We ordered delivery via Door Dash and everything was great, order was accurate, delivery was fast, food was excellent.

yKuxNIQ38B4EruZda5J9lw.text: Excellent sushi,  service and laid back feel.  Good cooks,  great unfiltered saki.  Small but nice.

8tJdH1jo35aYIAHNifvBdg.text: One word: Lunch special....wait TWO words. Haha.  Decided to hit up this place cause it's down the street from my work and it was a short lunch for me. Got the lunch special - their lunch special you get: miso soup, salad, and two of the meat items -- I got the chicken teriyaki and tonkatsu.   I put my order in and had my co-worker pick it up, apparently on their menu, you're supposed to get gyoza, tamago and inari sushi. But I didn't get that. Oh well.  Price is decent and quality is okay. Would come back to try out their rolls.

F_qHE-TJrp9x2XVHFm_NdQ.text: I really like this little place. It is hidden away in the retail hell of Stephanie Street down by the Sunset Station, but it is worth finding. Hit them on either Friday or over the weekend. I have been told that they get their fresh fish order on Friday and they tend to run out of some items as the week goes on. The Sushi is good and presented well with style and subdued beauty. They do not hide the flavor of their sushi with too much sauce, but instead rely on the quality of their fish and their work. They are quick and efficient. They have always been quick and efficient every visit I have made. My drink is never empty and a dirty dish does not sit on the table long.  They don't have an all you can eat so going on a sushi binge can get pricey. However, they do have a specials board behind the bar. I strongly urge you to take advantage of the specials as I have never been disappointed by them. They usually have a halibut sushi on the specials list that I simply love. Be brave when ordering because they have some pretty unique creations. Food courage is the most rewarding courage of all.   I sadly can't give them five stars because their was a sushi place I went to all the time in North Carolina which IMO is the best sushi I have ever had. It has simply ruined me and all other sushi I eat I compare to that place. Sadly, nothing has ever lived up to their quality, but Momo comes pretty darn close. I wouldn't say it's worth a trip across town, but if you are in the southeast of Vegas for any reason over the weekend, this is must. And tell Momo I said hi... (I don't know who the hell Momo is or even if there is a Momo, but a dare you to walk in and say "Doc says to tell Momo hi.")

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States. This is the halibut something or other they always have on the special&#39;s board. It&#39;s decently priced and very good. Try it!

Other reviews complain about the service, but I sat at the sushi bar and the chef was polite. When it came time to get my bill, the server was nowhere to be found, but I was one of only two customers. Their menu of rolls is considerable, but I'd probably stick to the same order if I returned.

YcSFPnR8735Zftm1zUAN7w.text: Probably the worst service we've ever experienced.   We were a party of 4 (myself, my wife, our 3 year-old and 6 month old). We ordered water and they only brought 2 of the three we asked for (nothing resembling a kid's cup) we eventually got another water when we ordered our food but it set the tone for the rest of the evening.   Food arrived relatively quickly and was average sushi, nothing remarkable. We ordered udon with chicken and the waitress though the best place to put it was directly in front of our 6 month-old. Before we could even react he grabbed the plate the bowl was on and pulled it, causing extremely hot udon to splash out onto his hand. Just about every other customer saw or heard what happened and audibly reacted, some even asked what they could do, not one single employee even bothered to see if there was anything they could do. As parents we understand and accept it is ultimately our responsibility to keep our kids from harm but who in their right mind would put steaming hot soup in front of a 6 month old...?  Our last roll was brought out about 5 minutes later and that was the last time we saw our waitress until we stopped her and asked for a container for the remaining udon. That was also the only time our water was refilled, after our food was gone and we were waiting for them to bring our bill.   When we arrived it was not very busy, by the time we received our food the dinning area had filled up  but there was never more than 1 group waiting to be seated. Had they been swamped with customers I would better understand the lack of service but there was no obvious explanation.   Needless to say we won't be returning; average food at best and even if the food had been exceptional the quality of service would keep us away.

0747Q-U_U75qWK3rE79c8Q.text: Excellent food, excellent service and they're fast! Every thing came fast and sushi tasted very fresh! !
