30ZfphFuOTMjG7gSFpdgdA.text: The new spot! Excellent sushi. Eric took care of our sushi entrees and they were delicious. One thing I really loved was how tight the rolls were. Usually I'll have a bunch of rice and ingredients piling up in my sauce bowl, and have to dump it out, but after all the rolls, all that was left was soy sauce with maybe 1-2 pieces of rice.  He even made us a personal chefs creation, which was different than the usual that we eat anywhere else but it was delicious! Great Sushi Chef!! (Pic added!) We also had dessert. At other sushi places, you might get one little scoop of ice-cream, but not at Momo Sushi, there was at LEAST 3 scoops in that bowl lol and I love ice cream, there's always room for dessert! Overall, we had a great experience and will definitely be going back, thankfully we live just around the corner! I definitely recommended it to anyone that wants to find a new place to go that is better than your usual! Thanks again Eric and Momo Sushi!

4by8o_BbKsiqInlPkiiEHQ.text: This review is long overdue... So my boyfriend and I decided to try this place on a whim early last year...and we were pleasantly surprised!  The food is fresh and delicious! We had the Ugly Roll, Screaming Honey, Palm-tree Roll, Sex on the Beach, Something Wrong 69, and When Shrimp Meets Crab. I would give the food 5 stars. The service, I would give 3.5 stars. The atmosphere, 3.5 stars as well. The waitresses are a little pushy and seem to rush you out as soon as you're done eating. The establishment itself is a little too dim for my liking and it's a little sloppy looking in my opinion - it looks more like someone's house rather than a restaurant. But overall, I would recommend this place for sushi if you're in the Green Valley area! We've been back multiple times ever since our first visit!

That was ten years ago and we have been going back(sometimes 3x's a week) ever since. Johnny and Julie have seen us go from kids on our second date to home owners and parents. We have seen quite a few chefs come through(Paul's korean love songs were the best). We have also seen a lot of waitresses over the years. The quality of the food and level of service have never dipped. Whenever I get a chance to turn someone on to sushi I bring them here with the disclaimer they will never find a spot better than mine. Come in, sit at the bar, order a 2for1 house hot sake, and let James make your favorite sushi spot "That place you used to go to."

QLnI9xllq6wdjXUVu4RwVQ.text: Just got takeout from here. I got the rock and roll, Irish, and stuffed tomato. A little spicier than most places, but still super good. Fresh fish and cucumber. I was here one other tomw but all i got was a cucumber salad and miso soup. Both delicious. Miso soup was amazing. I stood at the door for a while while everyone kind of looked at me, then a sushi chef yelled "CUSTOMER!!!" and everyone came up to me at once. There was a woman helping a little girl with math at one of the tables. Guessing it's a family owned joint. The sushi was delicious though, and I'll definitely be back.

_UR3bq1b0DL_DZ6uM7cpCQ.text: This was my first time here because my friend likes it came for lunch establishment it's not bad and it's not to busy for lunch not sure in the evening but my lunch special was good the nigiri looks fresh there was just one of my fish that tasted more like water but the rest of my food tasted good especially I choose the Philadelphia roll instead of the California roll with the sushi special that was delicious like I hope it would taste overall the food was good I would come back to tried more only issues is I like all you can eat service was ok it was like ahh that's why I give it 3.5 stars.

RR17snTIzeO1U4zr55OZJg.text: Early lunch. Why not have sushi? Place is clean and fast. From the moment we sat down the waitress took our drink orders and asked if we had any questions. I had the Goyza as an appetizer. Delicious! It was so good I forgot to take a picture of it and ate it all lol. Must try it out if you go to this place. Keep in kind it's not all you can eat so be selective of which plates you eat. Heart Attack roll was SPICY!! I also had seaweed salad- they serve a medium size portion compared to other sushi places I have been. Overall the food tasted good and we had a great time.

0GYcNwKjWmB0RYuLWbRkXw.text: First off, I'd like to say that I enjoyed the decor here. There are places to sit in a booth or on chairs and have a bar area that is easy to access.  Usually bars are placed in the back and you have to walk through the tables, but Momos had their bar in the front corner.  Easy access if it is a busy day.   When I arrived it was slow so service was great. However, when it became busy the service was becoming slow due to the restaurant only having two servers. I felt as if I had to flag one of the two servers down to place another order.   My boyfriend had the opportunity to visit Japan and while we were eating he had nothing but the best compliments about the sushi. He stated, "this reminds me of when I was back in Japan".   I enjoyed my meal as well, I had a lunch special and each space had a good portion of food. It wasn't too shy or too overwhelming. I was very pleased.  I drank the green tea and I have to say although it was a little light in taste, it was fairly good.

photos.caption: Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

Photo of Momo Sushi - Henderson, NV, United States

_rYv2aPQA8h3nvBtCfQSkQ.text: Momo sushi has a lot to offer.  A varied menu that includes hot dishes such as pork Cutlet bowl which my son has to have due to some anime where they eat pork Cutlet bowls. It is good but I wish the pork was fried crisper.  The sushi is very good and there is a large variety of rolls.  They also have a selection of bento lunch and dinner combos.  It is a very hands off service staff which is refreshing.  We enjoy hitting the book store across the street before grabbing a roll or two.

s5aSVBjIh99_zW8jwE3NRg.text: Yum! The salmon was of perfect quality. Great price for the quality you get.   I ordered a green tea, miso soup, green salad, ikura, tobiko, 2 Philadelphia rolls, and a California roll.   The sushi pieces are pretty big and the food is very filling :). I'd come back if ever in the area again

ALA7igaLQzPHTCYgF9fhBg.text: No AYCE here.  But you have to try this place!  Really good sushi for this area of town.  Fresh and fast service on a busy Thursday during the holiday season. Spicy shrimp, crab, cucumber and avocado-topped with avocado, red snapper tuna, salmon and screaming O sauce.    I'll be in this area a few time more this month and will return here each time!!  Yum!!

1qnATBYKfS8XeRBIzmbMXA.text: I'm from out of town and wanted to get my sushi fix. The sweet shrimp is what caught my eye. So I took my family here.  It was over all a 5 for taste. A 2 on service. Most waitresses were friendly and nice BUTTTTT.... one waitress left the whole experience crappy!  She has theee worst mannerisms. She rushed our food out screaming out rolls really fast and repeating herself constantly with her thick accent and shaking the dish like someone grab it!!! Rolled her eyes when we didn't understand her deep heavy accent also. Then they kept bring us out the wrong dish. Like 4 times! Wth?! This lady has short black bob cut hair.  The other ladies were very sweet though.   They did lose another point because when I asked for my roll with no rice they immediately said no and I was like WTH?! I go to loads of sushi spots. And I will judge your establishment if u can't accommodate. It's not hard?! Why do some places know how to and others say no?! It's laziness and or no experience on the sushi chef. After much debate... I had to tell them how to do it...add soy paper and crab meat if needed. When I got it they still sealed roll with rice and the edge. Like what if I had a gluten allergy? Smh.  This place does have really great selection of rolls and really fresh fish. So it sucks that everything else ruined it for them.

eNx0ZXH1NYUlb4HIoSyKeQ.text: Magically delicious! Lol! Tiny spot, but chill, relaxing setting. Really good sushi, miso soup, and sizzling Kalbi. A little pricey, but the taste of food is worth it.

uZoPuFEgW-1g4cOWJ42mvA.text: I've been going to Momo's for years & never have had an issue. I ordered take out and ordered a screaming orgasm and when I got home, I mixed everything together and went to take a bite of the ahi tuna and found a bug in my food. I was horrified and called Momo's to tell them what had happened. They recommended that I come back to the restaurant to show them the video and to get a refund. I went back a couple hours later and the sushi chef and waitress apologized and told me it had nothing to do with the fish as it would have been more of a parasitic worm, as this was more of a plant bug. They informed me it was from the sprouts on top of the screaming orgasm that they had received from a vendor and that in the future they will be more cautious as to cleaning the sprouts more thoroughly and they had already contacted the vendor.  They gave me a full refund and a gift card for the future. I have never had any problems with them previously and was very caught off guard when it happened.

8Nw5yUXpFS4sL0JFg9OB3w.text: Arguably our favorite sushi spot out of anywhere we've been in any state.  Great vibe for either an evening out with the young kids, a quick lunch break, or a date night.  The food is tasty, the service is quick, noninvasive, no mistakes.

JXrnRWNcz7TaKvzuH5M-RQ.text: While running errands on a Saturday afternoon, my boyfriend and I stopped here for lunch. It was relatively slow/empty, but had great reviews on yelp, so we decided to give it a shot!    The most important thing to mention is that almost all of their rolls feature crab mix, which I don't eat.  If you're like me, this place is not for you. If they are not busy, they will customize, but I get embarrassed when I have to do that.  We ordered two rolls and they were just okay; their sushi rice is kinda bland compared to others.  If you want awesome sushi, go to Tokyo Boys down the street.

xhOLWmsjcTaFVYxwFHTmbw.text: I Love this place and our chef Jay! Ask for the Toro sashimi and the poke salad. We always have fun!

Z2xilCTJ1Ikj3SPOZU9T9w.text: Like what some other reviewers have said, service here is pretty spotty. We were only a party of 2 so as long as we had our waters and orders correct, that's all I cared about. Pretty much you come in, place your order, they give you your food, you eat, pay for your bill and leave. Sure, the spicy tuna rolls and this other sushi roll my friend and I ordered were delicious but damn...the price was pretty expensive. $10-12 for spicy tuna rolls!? Come on now.... Then again...look at where Momo Sushi is located at: Henderson. There are plenty of other sushi places especially on the West side/Chinatown that have better prices.  The only reason why we came here for lunch was because we were in the area and we were craving for sushi.

zbp35pZesuBogqNG33urhw.text: The sushi was excellent and the service was great. The service was fast and the four of us enjoyed our meal and sushi at a really great price highly recommended

RXyl7DDSO2u8SqS4zcfGKQ.text: GREAT sushi. HORRIBLE service! The waiter spilled water all over our table and after coming to our table three times after that I had to ask him to please wipe it down or bring me napkins for me to do it. If you want good sushi, but do not mind bad service this is the place for you.

s-8Qdvpp-Q9v9FTqbcmhKQ.text: The sushi was some of the best I've had in town, however the service was AWFUL. Also, they do not have AYCE, but that doesn't affect my review.

KJ9UtEQge_D4Y1qdtYcbJA.text: I don't know where people are getting bad service, but it's not here. There was a large party, several families, and a bar full of people - and we still got super service. We ordered several rolls to share, and they came out as made, one at a time - and quick! Loved the Irish roll (but then, I would, huh?) The Orion roll was delightfully spicy and flavorful. The Rock-n-Roll did, in fact, rock. Hot tea got immediate refills without asking. Prices were mid-range. Sake prices were too high to bother with, though.  Clean, small, close to home, and yummy (and since Yummy shut down, we've been looking for another...)  My only complaint is that the music seriously bites. Bad rap-fusion-80's asian-not-sure-what-but-it's-bad. Just bad.  Music bad. Food good.

Ox7hZMDBn4QHiWPGf9ySOA.text: This is my first time here, the eel and avocado roll was delicious !  Very friendly staff and nice and quiet ambience. Very nice to unwind and relax. Definitely coming back :)

O7JEmqTD9TqpKHRzJhlVqg.text: Intimate atmosphere & friendly staff. More than just sushi on the menu... rice bowls, chicken teriyaki,  gyoza, etc. I was hoping for more traditional sushi choices, so it was hard to find rolls without cream cheese and crazy sauces. But they have creative specials & would be good for more adventurous sushi lovers. I got a tekka maki roll (tuna), sake (salmon on a ball of rice), & miso soup. Yummy sushi,  but I'm going to keep looking for somewhere more authentic.

rXOTeayyie8ETPS_cMivZg.text: Went for New Years Eve for the first time and it was delicious. Sushi was fresh and a good price. The decor could use a little freshening up, the booth I sat in was ripped .

Bwc0VObdBrVDENURZiTRsg.text: You get a lot of food for the price. We especially enjoyed the lunch special where you get to pick two entrees to go with soup, salad, and gyoza and rice.    I liked the salmon teriyaki, and the chicken katsu was pretty crispy. Ginger salad was good too.    My six year old said that the food was really yummy. The children's box is the same price as the lunch special. I would pick the lunch special since you get more selection.    My only complaint was that the hot water in the woman's bathroom is scalding.  My 6 year old burned 2 of her fingers washing her hands. So  if you are bringing children to the bathroom, you need to regulate the water. We did tell the waitress and hopefully they will turn the water down.  Overall, we will eat here again. I agree with Sunny D's review- sushi is right up there and the prices are reasonable only at lunch time.  We ordered take out for dinner, and the dinner menu prices were overpriced. I would eat here only for lunch. When we ordered take out, they forgot one menu item and we had to drive back and get the rest of the order.

dtxOoxkj1Ec3KwyuZP4E5w.text: This place is a hidden treasure !! All the staff are friendly & very accommodating.  Have back been several times & never disappointed highly recommend !!

D0-bv7_OYqx-a6sLcexlRw.text: Top sushi place.  If they have blue fin tuna, get it!  It's pricey at $10 for two pieces of sashimi, but it's well worth it if you like tuna.  Best I ever had.

-3kAZMkCzUgn6WOo4MJiig.text: My friend and I went there today and I liked that it wasn't too loud or quiet. However after placing my order I noticed a cockroach crawling by my foot and not just a regular roach a big ass one! So we left. I'm sure the food is good but we were totally grossed out by the roach.

qSFoG1Ev8juwjqo9iFeecA.text: I agree with Micheal H who said "consistently awesome sushi" and C.J. who wrote "it's not a showy place like Sushi Roku..etc." I don't eat bento boxes, so I would take other Yelper's word on those. But as far as sushi goes, it's my favorite place in this area. I've been a regular here for since 2005.  I always order the Momo Yellowtail Sashimi special. At $12-14 it's not that great of a deal but they serve it with more fish than other places; the yellowtail is cut perfectly and covered with the right amount of citrus sauce, jalapeno and cilantro. Sen of Japan adds a crispy topping to this dish that I like, but they charge a little more too.  All other rolls are great. The Rebecca used to be a favorite. I also like the Irish Roll.  Service can be a little slow when they're busy but the wait staff are very nice and work hard.

pr4rz8Y2SJdodw_zY5SRqQ.text: I'm actually pretty surprised this place has 4 stars. let me start off by saying I did go close to closing so that might have had a part into my bad experience. anyways, I went there probably a week ago and the sushi was just alright, nothing special.  Soft shell crab was no bueno.

4Lm-MrpoGPE_Ir4Br1XMkQ.text: This place is a favorite place for sushi, it is excellent quality especially for the price, which is reasonable. I come here often with my brother for sushi. The staff is friendly and the food is good.

D81H4uOsmgjDEdbk1QZrsw.text: My husband and I go here all the time. The sushi is excellent, the service is prompt, and the sushi chefs are friendly. It is not overpriced, and it is very laid back. I always get sushi- the SS Roll is really good, and it is gluten-free (my husband is allergic to wheat.) This place is rarely crowded, and the sushi is always fresh, so it is our go-to place for a casual night out :)

aaD6RPvkT-OR5aBcFOK5GQ.text: The sushi rolls were very good. We got some rolls and a bento box. The bento box was huge but the chicken that we ordered was very dry and had no flavor. Besides the sushi which is always good I wouldn't order the teriyaki chicken again.

q1dS54z8RhWpSH_P1Hku8w.text: Momo Sushi has taken over as the only place I find worth spending my hard earned money at to eat. Between the amazing cuts of fish, beyond exceptional customer service and very reasonable prices, I can't talk myself into going anywhere else when I go out to eat. The amount of personal attention received every time I visit keeps me coming back.

tc2iQplae1rfjgLleGV5yQ.text: Me and my family are big sushi eaters and this was the first time we ate at a Las Vegas sushi spot. We're from the bay area, California where there are some great sushi place and I must say, we did not like the sushi from here at all. We thought it was over priced for something so simple and it didn't even wow us. It was mediocre but we ate it because we were hungry. I recommend not to go here...please find some other sushi place. This place is not worth it. I hope not all sushi spots in LV are like this one.

d0Jj0TOe6BGIivwF4bt6EA.text: I've been here twice with my boyfriend and it's been great each time. The ugly roll is my favorite, along with one of the fruity sakes. The service in the dinning room is ok, but its nicer to sit at the sushi bar to watch the Chef prepare the rolls or ask for something they might not have on the menu .

jW-VZ-leUNdzAPMjzF9mRw.text: Consistently awsome sushi. always fresh great sushi chefs owner is very kind and personable. Try the live shell fish on weekends especially live scallop and abalone.  incredibly fresh salmon and tuna. spicy tuna hand rolls are very generous. they need some work on the salmon skin hand roll. no gobo root really come on.

CFaM7KrdZot8zWRKhS7oXg.text: "My favorite place for fresh sushi! Dine-in or order for pick up, the staff is always nice."

5G7rxDD_Z6-WyPbKlMwXyA.text: Ever time I go to Vegas..I just got to go to Momo Sushi restaurant. From the moment you walk in..till you leave..you are treated with the utmost hospitality. The food there is awesome..don't pass this place up..you'll definitely miss out a special place.

eP1rOaEkXskMtSV7sk_Q5A.text: Went there not expecting much as it was out first try at sushi in Henderson and we got a pleasant surprise.  The staff is very friendly and the food is good.  I am a HUGE fan of sushi and this place seems fresh to me, not to mention they have a huge list of Specialty rolls that i suggest trying.  Or you can sit at the sushi bar and tell them exactly what you want and they'll whip it up.  We've been back 3 times and it's been good every time, except one time they forgot a roll (a group of 6, so maybe smaller groups are better).  Very good, I always get a Tall Sapporo or Kirin Ichiban with my meal too, great beer.    Enjoy

J15BL3MnGIsIvx70AgJlHA.text: This place has an excellent selection. Their rolls are all reasonably priced. This was a perfect lunch meal. 3 rolls and a seaweed salad for under $30. They do not do All you can eat here but I think thats a good thing. Their quality is much higher as a result. The place itself is sort of hidden off the west side of Stephanie in a small strip mall. Definitely check this place out if you are a Sushi coniseur.

qHCuwbECjyV1esFxMVRkRw.text: Fantastic amazing sushi!  Tried this place out for the first time and it's unbelievable. Fresh and delicious with great service. I will definitely be regulars here considering I live down the street. I highly recommend this place.

WBuH1d1WbaqtqeyNnv48bg.text: Ordered carry out it was ready in 15 minutes. The sushi was great and just as expected! The staff was super friendly and helpful when arriving to pick it up.  Inside looked nice too while I was there, would love to eat in some time. Definitely recommended.

o7s-ErJNaWN1TROwE-wcFw.text: Came here last night with my friend because we were craving sushi and it was close to where we live. The food was good but the service...not so much. We walked in and the waitress asked how many and seated us at the bar, did not really smile at us or act friendly. I got a vibe that they were tired and wanted to go home. The next two people that walked in must of been regulars because the sushi chefs and waitresses immediately acknowledged them and said hello... Um, ok.  Anyhoo on the food...   I cannot complain about it,  it was really yummy. I got the Ninja box (teriyaki beef, shrimp/veggie tempura, spicy tuna roll (4 pieces) and some kind of dumpling?  Also came with salad and miso soup. My friend ordered the Jen 2 roll and the soft shell crab appetizer, she said both of them were good.   Pro's - Food was great, restaurant is small and cozy, large sushi bar space to eat (hate rubbing elbows with my neighbor)  Con's - Bitchy waitstaff, never asked us if we wanted a refill on our drinks even though they charged us almost $3 for a coke, the prices on the sushi rolls here are pretty expensive and they don't have AYCE, booo.

8ak0WkPjVmxX2e0wKG31LQ.text: Ordered the Momo and Seafood bentos. Tastes good, but I've definitely had just as good or better elsewhere for less $$$. The sushi was messy and poorly put together.  GF says to add that she really liked the age dashi tofu. Yes, I agree. That was good.

WcQIJVmsQ3Fp7Y4P9Ezr8g.text: This place is awesome! It's a little pricey compared to other sushi places around town. But nonetheless it's delicious!

PVA--nP9gplhbErcZ3jBBg.text: I have yet to have bad service here. As a regular sometimes you expect an off night. So far, it's been amazing. The quality of sushi is great, the guys here won't serve anything they don't like. And have always been up front on what's fresh etc. If you like Sashimi and you like it a bit spicy, then definitely try the Momo Hamachi appetizer. Its def one of my favorites. Perfectly sliced pieces of Hamachi, with a leaf of cilantro, and a thin slice of a jalapeno with a drop of sriracha...and Yuzu sauce (kind of a citrucy flavor) And after enjoying this, I usually get the Kiss of fire roll, and ask if they Have Sake Kama ( salmon collar ). Over all the atmosphere and staff are good. Its not overly loud, and the inside styling is like most pacific rim Japanese restaurants. There are other great rolls and cooked fare as well. Just have a look at their menu. momosushilasvegas.com/ho...

tfyNPvXda-AGGxl-YZhxJQ.text: One of the best Japanese meals I've had in town, and my husband was pleased at how quickly we got served. I had the Momo box-- excellent tempura! Will definitely be back!

3IeBdstBC2-Uj2EXncZWug.text: Found hair in my food and they didn't apologize or discount the meal... they just looked at me & said thats not hair... but then after examining it closer they said yeah its hair then took the plate. Unsanitary! No customer service!

WrlAfW-2R-on5kZtGuEaEw.text: This place is very clean and the decor is inviting. The sushi chef are more interactive when you sit at the bar. Very appropriate for a date night or any special occasion. Prices are comparable.

CSZnwSmqhCKPPETQpRizTA.text: Hit and miss but overall pretty good. The service is often lacking but the food is so darn good we still make a visit every so often. The teriyaki chicken is a must try.

xcdSRHF3DGGrMhCyc_19Ww.text: My favorite local sushi place!!! Go there ALL the time. Love the rolls and the sashimi is great too. Irish Roll is our number one. Reasonable prices and never too overcrowded.

Cirw7lfQoREmoaNRQbFcbg.text: Is it amazing? No. So far, we haven't found an amazing, 5 star worthy, sushi restaurant in Vegas/Henderson. :(. BUT its second to I Love Sushi, and a close second at that.  The location is great, and it is our go-to spot when we're craving sushi. It is a solid place to get your Japanese food fix. It won't wow you, but it won't disappoint either. I recommend the crispy spicy tuna--- it's REALLY really good. You can find it on the "special" menu. :)

8Tt7YUoqbweLAevu8_IN2Q.text: I took my Mom here today for lunch and was impressed with the Ahi tuna poki, while my Mom went fir the rolls. We'll be back for dinner soon! The prices are very reasonable.

vZ19I7nqX1TsFfgJAqvrRw.text: There just aren't enough good things to say about this place!  The service is AMAZING.  Everybody is so friendly, and Chef B especially makes visiting Momo a welcome and entertaining experience each and every time.    The food has never disappointed.  We've probably tried everything on the menu at least once, but our absolute favorite top two things to order are the Henry Roll and the Ugly Roll.  Sometimes, when we don't know what we want, B takes over and just creates something for us on the fly.. he's truly a very talented and detail oriented chef!!!  Sometimes we'll visit other sushi places, but we always regret we didn't just go to Momo Sushi instead.  It's as good as it gets in our book!

FURr2XZIpI5pFgfp1wI34g.text: I have been going to Momo's ever since they have been opened and that has been well over 7 yrs ago. I have recently moved to Seattle, WA and have not found my new sushi place and having Momo withdrawals.   I just wanted to say that they have amazing food and provide a friendly Atmosphere. I don't think anybody could be disappointed.  I would highly recommend the spicy baby Tako it is delicious and you wont find it anywhere else.   The customer service is great. The owner and the staff know my family by our names which is awesome. The best seats are obviously at the sushi bar.   I can't wait to come back to Henderson its the first place I will visit.

do8siEKqR_2xrZK9ueXRHw.text: The food here is amazing! The staff is friendly and provide excellent service. It's a very clean and fun environment. Highly recommend this place for sushi and Japanese cuisine.

Yelp didnt exist back then but i would have rated them the same as i am doing so now. They have incredible rolls and food quality is second to none! Highly recommended for sushi !

It5mesWYxxJEnGgRTv70mA.text: I stopped in for lunch on a Sunday and there weren't many people around. The waitress was attentive and friendly. I wanted to order sushi, and it's awesome that they had pictures of what their sushi rolls looked like, but as I mentioned, I was too stuffed from eating the lunch special. The kiss of fire roll was good, but it lacked heat in which I was really looking forward too. I've had the kiss of fire roll from Sakana sushi, so I was expecting some good heat from Momo's version , after all it is called the "Kiss of Fire" right???? The Johnny Roll was good as well. Other than the above, overall it was a good restaurant and the rolls are a good sized portion, so I can't really complain.

ODWnL-y6mwhW9LA--b9z0Q.text: We went into Momo about 8:30pm on New Years Eve and it was very quiet. Sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were ready to help. They have a big sushi menu and dinner menu. This is one of the better sushi places in Vegas. Glad we stopped in in a whim.

6NJYMH3cqCIsucApGF_gjQ.text: Even tho we don't get to go here as often as I'd like, I still consider Momo Sushi one of the better sushi restaurants in Henderson. During our most recent visit back at the end of February, they finally had the live shrimp that we had wanted to try on our 1st visit so we got an order of that. 5CCz7oGIFzjmEGUNC7cTXQ.text: Wow!  I think I am becoming a biased reviewer of Momo. The  last item we ordered and received was the Momo Kampachi. What a way to finish off a wonderful meal.   The staff is warm and welcoming. James the chef as you see from the picture is an artist and I ate his Mona Lisa. Just so fresh and vibrant. The fresh wasabi popes with spice and the super white tuna was so clean tasting with a hint of lemon added.   All rolls were just a great the standard screaming 'o' is a must in our book. Tuna with ponzu sauce and some mayo which of course is bad but tastes so so good.   Jon and Julie have made a place we love. We found Momo over a decade ago and are still in love. -iubQSwzuc_oWlLPMnQSzA.text: When I was in San Francisco 2 weeks ago, I drove all the way to try the best chinese chicken wings at San Tung.  I wasn't too impressed because I ordered the dry ones and got the wet wings.... However, out of this Barry F messaged me to try it again and stated that when he comes to Henderson, he loves MOMO Sushi so he was surprised I did not review it...  I took the opportunity to check this out over the weekend and I loved it.  Thanks Barry.  The environment - Cozy, soft lighting, nice sushi bar, the place is just right to me. It seems that it was perfectly suited to be a sushi restaurant. It just works right!  The service - A bit homey and homestyle, so you get both caring people who can be a bit slow at times.  Hey, you know what, that is okay with me because it feels like family.  The Sushi - This is where the place excels.  Had several orders of  Uni, Amai Ebi, Maguro, Tai, Hamachi, It was all so very good.  Large nice pieces of fish and very flavorful. You should be aware that they do use the wasabi on the sushi between the rice and the fish, so if you don't want it, you should tell them.  I enjoy it but my son prefers to not have wasabi.  I was not happy that they did not have the Toro that was on the menu and the Kai as they were out.  I also ordered Mirugai and they were out of this too.  Boo hoo.  I would have marked them a 4 star for the food but what they did have was awesome.  I have to give kudos to the Amai Ebi.  The fried shrimp head was so plump and so delicious.  I wonder if they somehow stuffed the them heads with something way deliciouso???  We also had some seriously large rolls like Tiger, Dragon, and a few others.  All were good and tasty, just that I am not a huge Roll person.  The price - For about 4-5 rolls and all the nigiri sushi, we spent about 100.00 so while for the three of us it was more expensive than an AYCE place, the quality was amazing.  GK says, check it out...

IHooKKahE8MLXuRn7xWNsg.text: I have been going to Momo Sushi for 11 years, ever since they first opened. I have tried everything on the menu! I love the rolls, and all the different sauces they make. 3EyVYU4HyY-X-ex1JeAEMQ.text: I really like Momo. I usually have to cross town to get good sushi but I'm so glad I found a place close to home that is really good. Pz-lY3E9XHs9KTo0J6rfVw.text: I've been going to MOMO for many years.  It is the closest thing I have to a "home" sushi place.  I'm eternally impressed with the quality of the fish and the friendliness of the staff.  We've gotten to know Jhonny (yes, it's spelled that way) the owner and even see him around Henderson, giving it an even more local feel.  The sushi chefs are fairly consistent and are quick to suggest things not on the menu.  We are sushi purists (always prefer sashimi to anything resembling catfood and/or covered in "yumyum" sauce!) and usually go in and request "the best fish you have."  This can be dangerous for the wallet at times -- but always results in luscious, large chunks of fish.   I've grown especially fond of the AJI (spanish mackerel sashimi).  The body of the fish (skeleton, tail & head) are used as a serving plate for the sashimi.  After you are finished, the take the fish body, fry it up, and reserve it to you as a crispy snack.

nZ6HHyXdHKAOwG66VqujIg.text: Haven't been in a couple of years and it's still on the top of the list!  Went last night and had the most amazing new roll. . Something wrong 69. Of course right after a screaming oo. Left the last roll up to the sushi chef and he was right on point. Just as Delicious as I always remembered!

XKmeLe-VprfgC5lD5knMoQ.text: I really owe this place 20 more great reviews because we go there all the time and I've never been disappointed.  The fish is always fresh and Johnny will create a roll for you if you can't find one on the menu you like. The staff is like family and very friendly. This is still my favorite place!!

vWRUSIU1EPBzfx9a1x8HJQ.text: Have been several times and every time it delivers the goods.  My wife and I love every visit as we have a long list of favorites we now order.  Highly recommend to any sushi lovers out there. Great food at a great price

hDIe3DD8GT6sLwMTQuLSvg.text: The sushi was really high quality along with their beef and chicken. The wait staff is very nice.

Kk_rpV_mGO5T4fMLsaCQKg.text: Momo Sushi is my absolute favorite place to go for sushi. I wish they had All You Can Eat, but I'm pretty sure they don't because the quality of the fish is so high! They would definitely lose money on it, haha. I love their sashimi, the sushi chefs here are amazing! I leave always satisfied and happy. Great service, great quality, and super cozy. I have been coming here for over a decade and I will always return.

PTIltIipPI-3bMRXxVIAeQ.text: momo's is small and cozy... it's a family owned place and so gracious!  i love sushi chef james... he makes me specialities not on the menu.  : )  affordable, fresh seafood and nice ppl.  cant go wrong.  no all you can eat sushi here. but they do have 2 for 1 house sake.

sDA2smjEocNBXucdPHNXrQ.text: This is the only sushi restaurant I go to. My boyfriend loves the lunch special. They have delicious special rolls. I highly recommend stopping in there if you are in the area.

zq2RrMbZejyYiTdS9psVNg.text: Best Sushi place in all of Henderson!  There fish is the freshest I have eaten in the middle of the desert with no "fishy" taste at all!   If your new to sushi go with the Screaming O and a triple A roll.  You will not be disappointed!

UU_AQVjKXbPRWswJulWYNw.text: They have original rolls, paired with amazing sauces.  I have never tasted so many great flavors in a sushi roll.  I have spend more $ on sushi and this was far better and you can chill at the sushi bar and watch football, love it!!!!

XmLBFbOx-as8-hWfxHqq4Q.text: My husband and I love this place! The food is excellent and the prices are great! We love Megun one of the servers there. She knows us by name and remembers what we drink even though we only eat there maybe once a month. Love this place!

6mlkbEYvCAcGxBFdNdDRjg.text: I was pleasantly surprised to see that the place was crowded and the sushi bar almost full! I saw the beautiful tuna the chef was apportioning and wrapping well to keep nice and chilled. My friend and I both had the lunch boxes and I shamefully ate everything on my plate!! It was a bit pricey but if it insures fresh fish and well cooked food- then it follows they buy the best top of the line fish. I read from a chef's diary, that discount sushi bars buy the cheapest quality fish - so I am going by that nugget of inside info. I am giving this 4 stars because service can be improved. The waitress might be overworked, underpaid and undertipped. I would go back there again - for sure!!!

9g-Mi_YvY0n-mE7Prr2-eg.text: I've only been here a couple times. The food is good and it's a nice quiet place to relax and enjoy. Staff is friendly and pretty quick with whatever you need.
